channel.title: A-Town at the Movies
channel.description: A film podcast from the insanely unique perspective of two midwesterners discussing movies new and old. Website: atownmovies.com Twitter: @atownmoviesfm Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/atownfm Tags: atownfm atownmovies
channel.itunes:author: Charlie Chapman, Dan Litz

item.title: Us
item.description:
Grab your largest pair scissors because this week our hosts are taking on their tethered other halves as they review Jordan Peele's new film Us!

item.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
item.description:
This week we watched a little film called Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets... a film tha Dan originally walked out of in theaters. So did anything change the second time around? Listen for a life changing revelation!

  • Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
  • Valerian Chase Scene

  • Reddit

item.title: Jaws: Fallen Kingdom (The Meg)
item.description:
This week our hosts review the film of our age, The Meg. A Melvillian tale about a man overcoming his demons to live again, The Meg will surely delight the poets in us all for ages to come. So buckle up in your Naboo ships and prepare to enter the trench!

Show Notes

The Meg

Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets

Patreon

item.title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom
item.description:
This week our hosts ignored all warning signs, people shouting at us, and pointing behind us at something to plunge heard first into the jaws of "Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom". Will we be saved by a T-Rex with a cape and change of heart, spurning his carnivorous ways just in the nick of time? Or will the film fall flat after the writers rooms brains are sold on the black market for seed money to make super raptors that can rip through tanks. Listen to find out!

Show Notes

Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom

Jurassic World

atownmovies.com

item.title: Incredibles 2
item.description:
Special guest Kristen replaces Dan this week as we discuss the 14 year follow up to Brad Bird's 2004 masterpiece of animation "The Incredibles". Does "Incredibles 2" live up to the first? Listen to find out!

item.title: I, Tonya

item.title: Deadpool 2
item.description:
Hi there. You may be finding yourself on this podcast thinking ‚Äúis this some sort of questionable third rate movie podcast where two dudes sit in their mom's basements and talk about movies? What sort of insight could they possibly have on the movie Deadpool 2 that other better podcasts couldn‚Äôt have?‚Äù Let me say this: I hear you. The answer is that we‚Äôre narcissistic egomaniacs that think you should listen to this episode. But maybe that‚Äôs just enough? Probably not. But ask yourself this: if you‚Äôve read this episode description this far haven‚Äôt you already put in enough investment to ride it out? Sure, it might not all pan out how you‚Äôve hoped. But at this point you owe it to us and yourself to finish up here. Go ahead. Press play. Maybe you‚Äôll like it. Probably not.

Show Notes:

Deadpool

X-Men Origins: Wolverine

Deadpool Marketing Roundup (TheVerge)

Horrible Rob Liefeld Drawings

Spiderman Deadpool Comic
item.content:encoded:

The answer is that we‚Äôre narcissistic egomaniacs that think you should listen to this episode. But maybe that‚Äôs just enough? Probably not. But ask yourself this: if you‚Äôve read this episode description this far haven‚Äôt you already put in enough investment to ride it out? Sure, it might not all pan out how you‚Äôve hoped. But at this point you owe it to us and yourself to finish up here. Go ahead. Press play. Maybe you‚Äôll like it. Probably not.

item.title: Solo: A Star Wars Story

item.title: Avengers: Infinity War (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description: This week Charlie and Dan collect all the infinity stones to summon the ability to talk about Infinity War for an hour and a half. One of us is a Grumpy Gus, the other is a Happy Hal. Listen and figure out which is which.

item.title: Star Wars: The Last Jedi (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description:
Episode XXVII

Star Wars: The Last Jedi has released! After two years of waiting and theorizing the galaxy has finally delivered the next chapter in the ongoing saga.

Does the film live up to expectations? Does the audience finally get answers to burning questions? How have audiences reacted to the movie? What new questions have arisen?

In a galaxy filled with turmoil two brave adepts are sent into their local theaters to confront the new film and dissect it for your pleasure‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Episode XXVII

Star Wars: The Last Jedi has released! After two years of waiting and theorizing the galaxy has finally delivered the next chapter in the ongoing saga.

Does the film live up to expectations? Does the audience finally get answers to burning questions? How have audiences reacted to the movie? What new questions have arisen?

In a galaxy filled with turmoil two brave adepts are sent into their local theaters to confront the new film and dissect it for your pleasure‚Ä¶
item.itunes:subtitle:
Episode XXVII
Star Wars: The Last Jedi has released! After two years of waiting and theorizing the galaxy has finally delivered the next chapter in the ongoing saga.
Does the film live up to expectations? Does the audience finally get answers to burning questions? How have audiences reacted to the movie? What new questions have arisen?
In a galaxy filled with turmoil two brave adepts are sent into their local theaters to confront the new film and dissect it for your pleasure‚Ä¶

item.title: Justice League (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description: On this weeks episode the A-Town Society of Friends review the newest edition to the DCEU with special guest Zack Buck! Through brightest day and darkest night, no detail escapes our sight!
item.content:encoded: On this weeks episode the A-Town Society of Friends review the newest edition to the DCEU with special guest Zack Buck! Through brightest day and darkest night, no detail escapes our sight!

item.title: Thor Ragnarok (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description: This week the halls of Valhalla are shaken to the core as we reveal our review of Thor: Ragnarok. In the first third of our assault we also get wildly off topic several times. To Asgard!
item.content:encoded: This week the halls of Valhalla are shaken to the core as we reveal our review of Thor: Ragnarok. In the first third of our assault we also get wildly off topic several times. To Asgard!

item.title: Blade Runner 2059 (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description: In this episode, we review the new wildly successful totally not underperforming in the box office film Blade Runner 2049. In addition we mix in a whirlwind of Phillip K Dick adaptation talk, the Leto mystery box, and a pinch of dune film discussion.
item.content:encoded: In this episode, we review the new wildly successful totally not underperforming in the box office film Blade Runner 2049. In addition we mix in a whirlwind of Phillip K Dick adaptation talk, the Leto mystery box, and a pinch of dune film discussion.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we review the new wildly successful totally not underperforming in the box office film Blade Runner 2049. In addition we mix in a whirlwind of Phillip K Dick adaptation talk, the Leto mystery box, and a pinch of dune film discussion.

item.title: Dunkirk (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description: This week we delve deep into catacombs of issues such as IMAX vs regular film, sound quality in film, and possibilities of VR films in the future. Once we defeat the dungeon master Hans Zimmer and rescue the princess we come back up to the surface world to review Christopher Nolan‚Äôs latest film Dunkirk.

item.title: War for the Planet of the Apes (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description: On this episode, our two intrepid hosts get a little ‚Äúbananas‚Äù when they review the crown of the Planet of the Apes reboot trilogies third film: War for the Planet of the Apes.

item.title: Spider-Man Homecoming (A-Town Rerelease)
item.description:
Welcome true believers!

On this weeks episode our two hosts take on their biggest feat yet by discussing the newest addition to the MCU Spider-Man homecoming.

As an added bonus they also rank each Spider-Man film in order from worst to best.

You won‚Äôt want to miss their penetrating analysis of this timely topic for the ages!
